verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the \sc Lord\sc* in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which \add was\add* the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
For then the king of Babylon’s army besieged Jerusalem: and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison, which \add was in\add* the king of Judah’s house.

For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Behold, I \add will\add* give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;

and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes:
and he shall lead Zedekiah \add to\add* Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: though ye fight with the Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper.
And Jeremiah said, The word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto me, saying,

Behold, Hanameel the son of Shallum thine uncle \add shall\add* come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that \add is\add* in Anathoth: for the right of redemption \add is\add* thine to buy \add it\add*.

So Hanameel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that \add is\add* in Anathoth, which \add is\add* in the country of Benjamin: for the right of inheritance \add is\add* thine, and the redemption \add is\add* thine; buy \add it\add* for thyself. Then I knew that this \add was\add* the word of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And I bought the field of Hanameel my uncle’s son, that \add was\add* in Anathoth, and weighed him the money, \add even\add* seventeen shekels of silver.
And I subscribed the evidence, and sealed \add it\add*, and took witnesses, and weighed \add him\add* the money in the balances.
So I took the evidence of the purchase, \add both\add* that which was sealed \add according to\add* the law and custom, and that which was open:

and I gave the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, in the sight of Hanameel mine uncle’s \add son\add*, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the book of the purchase, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the prison.
And I charged Baruch before them, saying,

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Take these evidences, this evidence of the purchase, both which is sealed, and this evidence which is open; and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may continue many days.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, the God of Israel; Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.
Now when I had delivered the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed unto the \sc Lord\sc*, saying,
Ah Lord \sc God\sc*! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power and stretched out arm, \add and\add* there is nothing too hard for thee:

thou shewest lovingkindness unto thousands, and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them: the Great, the Mighty God, the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, \add is\add* his name,
great in counsel, and mighty in work: for thine eyes \add are\add* open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings:
which hast set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, \add even\add* unto this day, and in Israel, and amongst \add other\add* men; and hast made thee a name, as \add at\add* this day;
and hast brought forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with great terror;
and hast given them this land, which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;

and they came in, and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice, neither walked in thy law; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them:

behold the mounts, they are come \add unto\add* the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans, that fight against it, because of the sword, and \add of\add* the famine, and \add of\add* the pestilence: and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and behold, thou seest \add it\add*.
And thou hast said unto me, O Lord \sc God\sc*, Buy thee the field for money, and take witnesses; for the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
Then came the word of the \sc Lord\sc* unto Jeremiah, saying,
Behold, I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Behold, I \add will\add* give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:

and the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set fire on this city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.

For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have only done evil before me from their youth: for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
For this city hath been to me \add as\add* a provocation of mine anger and of my fury from the day that they built it even unto this day; that \add I\add* should remove it from before my face,

because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
And they have turned unto me the back, and not the face: though \add I\add* taught them, rising up early and teaching \add them\add*, yet they have not hearkened to receive instruction.
But they set their abominations in the house, which is called by my name, to defile it.

And they built the high places of Baal, which \add are\add* in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through \add the fire\add* unto Molech; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my mind, that \add they\add* should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.

And now therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of Israel, concerning this city, whereof ye say, It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence;

behold, I \add will\add* gather them out of all countries, whither I have driven them in mine anger, and in my fury, and in great wrath; and I will bring them again unto this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely:
and they shall be my people, and I will be their God:
and I will give them one heart, and one way, that \add they\add* may fear me for ever, for the good of them, and of their children after them:
and I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from them, to do them good; but I will put my fear in their hearts, that \add they\add* shall not depart from me.
Yea, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.
And fields shall be bought in this land, whereof ye say, \add It is\add* desolate without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.

\add Men\add* shall buy fields for money, and subscribe evidences, and seal \add them\add*, and take witnesses in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, and in the cities of the mountains, and in the cities of the valley, and in the cities of the south: for I will cause their captivity to return, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
